{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3502586,"name":"","username":"henzo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T07:18:34.076Z","cooked":"

Hey all.

Our team has decided to use QFRCDashboard, specifically the Reef display widget to more visually display where the robot will go to using on-the-fly path generation. To display the Reef display, you had to provide a boolean array via SmartDashboard. When I would change the values Reef displays in QFRCDashboard while in robot simulation mode, the read values (SmartDashboard.getBooleanArray) would not change. Furthermore, the Boolean array wouldn’t appear in the SmarthDashboard app. Finally, I tried a sanity check by giving SmartDashboard an integer and then changing it through QFRCDashboard, which worked.

image852×940 46 KB

*Reef class is being instantiated in RobotContanier along with the Reef’s boolean array.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Sincerely, Henry

henzo:

*Reef class is being instantiated in RobotContanier along with the Reef’s boolean array.

I’m not sure exactly what this means. Where are you putting the “Reef” to SmartDashboard? See Reef Display · Q-FRC/Dashboard Wiki · GitHub

If there’s no putBooleanArray, then your getBooleanArray will always return the dafault, which you defined as m_reefStatus, so that’s why it never changes.

Sorry, I wasn’t clear enough. In the RobotContainer constructor, I’m putting the boolean array.
